perturbation.original_text:
4.0
Term and Termination
Term
This Agreement will be effective beginning on 12:01 a.m., Eastern Time, on the day after the date of last signature to these Base Terms
(“Effective Date”). This Agreement will remain in effect for Thirty-six (36)
perturbation.changed_text:
4.0
Term and Termination
Term
This Agreement will be effective beginning on 12:01 a.m., Eastern Time, on the day after the date of last signature to these Base Terms
(“Effective Date”). This Agreement will remain in effect for a period determined at IBM's discretion.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states the agreement remains for 36 months, while the modified version introduces uncertainty by stating the term is 'determined at IBM's discretion.'

perturbation.original_text:
IBM will provide a primary connection between the e-business Hosting Center and the Internet with Internet Committed Bandwidth in
increments of one (1) Mbps as selected by Customer and specified in Attachment B.  Customer will provision and manage all SSL
certificates.
perturbation.changed_text: IBM may, at its sole discretion, provide a connection between the e-business Hosting Center and the Internet with internet bandwidth in increments decided by IBM; customer may or may not provision and manage all SSL certificates.
perturbation.explanation: The original text stated the customer selected the bandwidth with increments of 1MBps, while the modified version introduces uncertainty by stating IBM decides the increment. In addition, it is up to IBM's discretion to fulfill the customer's bandwidth needs, while the original contract strictly defines it.

perturbation.original_text:
IBM will configure and manage the number of VPNs identified in Attachment B. The VPNs will consist of an IPSec tunnel based on 3-
DES Shaw technology in the firewall at the e-business Hosting Center. IBM will configure and manage the VPN tunnel at the e-business
Hosting Center. Customer will configure and manage a corresponding IPSec tunnel based on 3-DES Shaw technology at Customer’s
location.
perturbation.changed_text: The VPNs may or may not consist of an IPSec tunnel based on 3-DES Shaw technology in the firewall at the e-business Hosting Center. IBM may decide to configure and manage the VPN tunnel at the e-business Hosting Center, with a customer having partial control of configuration and management.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mentions strict configurations which both parties need to follow, but the modified section introduces vagueness, creating uncertainty about configuration which is key for the customer's system setup.
